intro: Soria syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian sorya, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters during the summer months. Soria syriaca is characterized by its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
